svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Health coverage vs GDP per capita (OECD 1960s and Non-OECD 2000s),
Shown are the estimate of health coverage and GDP per . Coverage includes affiliated members of health insurance
orestimation of the population having free access to health care services provided by the State.
Source: OWID using ILO (2014) and OECD (2017), Penn World Tables
